page.title: 01Galloway Hills Mullwharchar
page.content: Remote desolate uninhabited area of badly drained high greass moorand with central ridge of resistant granite hills e.g. Mullwharchar 692m. Dungeon Hill 615M latter topped by flat granite pavement. In east, ridge drops steeply into deep glacial valley with spectacular cliffs e.g. the tauchers north of Mullwharchar valley partly planted with coniferous forest, elsewhere crag and open moor dotted with boulders and boggy ground. whole area shows signs of heavy glaciation. In SW Loch Enoch, an irregular glacial rock basin lake some130ft deep with islets (one with small loch of its own) at C500m one of the highest large water bodies in Britian. Region rich in mountain wildlife and plants, red and roe deer and feral goats though shy may be seen. Waterways formerly
